newsitem.title: HUNGARY: NABI starts trading above issue price.
newsitem.headline: NABI starts trading above issue price.

text.p: Shares in Hungary's North American Bus Industries (NABI) debuted on the Budapest Stock Exchange at a price well above its IPO price.
The stock opened at 4,620 forints, above the 3,280 forint IPO price, and moved gradually higher. At 0953 GMT it traded at 5,200 forints.
"People seem to be ready to pay any price for the share," a trader said. "It's a good company, still, I think 5,000 forint price is a little expensive."
The trader added demand was strong for the paper while the supply side was tight.

NABI assembles buses in Alabama, U.S., from Hungarian-built bodies and chassis mainly for the U.S. market. It is majority owned by the First Hungary Fund, a closed-end equity fund based in Jersey, Channel Islands.
